revised_title: The Mechanism of Nemeritis Resistance to Defence Reactions in Insects
tldr: The author investigates the resistance of the ichneumon wasp Nemeritis to defence reactions in insects, specifically focusing on the small wax moth Achroia grisella. They discover that a protective coating on the surface of Nemeritis eggs and larvae prevents the insects' blood cells from reacting to the parasitoid. This coating is composed of minute particles that inhibit the adhesion of blood cells, providing resistance to the defence reactions of various hosts.
